title: Humanism and Healthcare Ethical Challenges in the 21st Century
sitename: ILUSTRE COLEGIO OFICIAL DE MÉDICOS DE MADRID
text:
Humanism and Healthcare Ethical Challenges in the 21st Century
- Valores Éticos y Medicina Moderna. Rafael del Rio.
- Valores Éticos y Farmacia Moderna. Marta de Zarandieta Romero.
- Atención Sanitaria y Situaciones Vulnerables. Carlo Bellieni (Italia).
- La Bioética desde el punto de vista de los pacientes con enfermedades crónicas. Carina Escobar/David Flores.
- Principios Bioéticos y dependencia. Javier Font.
- Principios Bioéticos y orden social. María José Borrego Gutiérrez.
- Principios Bioéticos y derecho. Federico de Montalvo.
- Principios Bioéticos y política. Federico Mayor Zaragoza.
- Objeción de conciencia y movimiento provida. Mónica López Barahona.
- Objeción de conciencia y aborto. Tonio Borg (Malta).
- Objeción de conciencia y eutanasia. Will Johnston (Canadá).
- Objeción de conciencia y farmacia. Antonio Molina.
- Juramento hipocrático y educación médica. Annette Hanson (EE.UU.).
- Valores neohipocráticos y educación farmacéutica. María Davó Mogica.
- El Juramento Hipocrático hoy. Nikos Kastanos (Grecia).
- Ethical Values and Modern Medicine. Rafael del Rio
- Ethical Values and Modern Pharmacy. Marta de Zarandieta Romero
- Health care and vulnerable situations. Carlo Bellieni (Italy)
- Bioethics from the point of view of pts with chronic diseases. Carina Escobar/David Flores
- Bioethics principles and dependence. Javier Font
- Bioethics principles and social order. María José Borrego Gutiérrez
- Bioethics principles and law. Federico de Montalvo
- Bioethics principles and politics. Federico Mayor Zaragoza
- Conscientious objection and pro-life movement. Mónica López Barahona
- Conscientious objection and abortion. Tonio Borg (Malta)
- Conscientious objection and euthanasia. Will Johnston (Canada)
- Conscientious objection and pharmacy. Antonio Molina
- Hippocratic Oath and Medical Education. Annette Hanson (USA)
- Neohippocratic values and Pharmacy Education. María Davó Mogica
- Hippocratic Oath Today. Nikos Kastanos (Greece).
Head of the Vithas Neurophysiology and Sleep Disorders Unit in Madrid.
President of the Ethics and Deontology Commission of ICOMEM
Member of the Central Ethics Commission of CGCOM
Adjunct Professor CEU San Pablo University
Head of Center of European Narcolepsy Network
Doctor of Medicine UAM
Specialist in Clinical Neurophysiology
Master Bioethics and Training Lateran and Sacro Cuore Universities of Rome.
President of the College of Physicians (Madrid).
Professor of Medicine. Universidad Europea de Madrid.
Head of Section Acute Cardiac Care (Department of Cardiology). Hospital General Universitario Gregorio Marañón.
Associate Professor. Universidad Complutense de Madrid. Spain.
President of the Spanish Society of Cardiovascular Infections.
Vice President of the Interprofessional Association of the Madrid Region.
Degree in Pharmacy from the Complutense University of Madrid Expert in Orthopedics (University of Alcalá).
Expert in Clinical Nutrition (Autonomous University of Madrid).
Owner of the Pintor Sorolla Orthopedics Pharmacy, in Móstoles (Madrid).
Member of the Network of Sentinel Pharmacies of the Community of Madrid.
Professor Carlo Bellieni teaches pediatrics at the University of Siena (Italy). His field of research is infantile and fetal pain, where he has published books, chapters of encyclopaedias and numerous articles of high scientific impact. He recently published the textbook "A new evolutive-holistic approach to Pediatric Palliative Care" for the publisher Springer. His studies have been taken up by the mass media all over the world, especially those on pollution caused by physical factors and those on social human behavior such as laughter and tears.
He has been retired for 9 years due to his illness.
He is a member of the Council for the Promotion of Accessibility and Removal of Architectural Barriers and the Advisory Council for People with Disabilities of the Community of Madrid and the Municipal Council for Disability of the Madrid City Council.
She received a PhD in Chemical Sciences (Specialty in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology) 1991 and a Master's in Philosophy (1996-1998). General Academic Director of the Center for Biosanitary Studies. Numerous publications in the field of Bioethics.
Tonio Borg is Associate Professor in Public Law at the University of Malta. He is a former European Commissioner , and former Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Malta. He was member of the Maltese Parliament between 1992-2012. He is the author of several books On Maltese Constitutional Law.
Will Johnston is a family physician in Vancouver, Canada, and has been active in the debate over medical euthanasia and assisted suicide for several decades. He is a past president of Canadian Physicians for Life and the current chair of Euthanasia Resistance British Columbia.
Graduated in Human Nutrition.
Specialist Technician in Orthopedics.
Master in Bioethics.
Owner and technical director of La Masó Pharmacy, Madrid.
Corresponding academic of the Royal National Academy of Medicine of Spain.
Vice President of Education and Specialty of the European Academy of Allergy and Clinical Immunology.
Member of the Professionalism Committee of the Illustrious Official College of Physicians of Madrid.
Director of the Chair of Medical Education and Humanization "Nemesio Diez".
Dr. Annette Hanson is the program director for the University of Maryland forensic psychiatry fellowship program. She teaches civil rights law to psychiatrists in training and served as an expert witness in correctional litigation over suicide prevention. As chair of the Maryland Psychiatric Society's legislative committee she testified regarding assisted suicide laws and provided written testimony in several American jurisdictions.
President Ápex University Association (2019-2023)
Great interest in science, biomedical research and the study of the ethical aspects that this entails.
Appointed Hippocratic Ambassador (Kos Municipality), he is co-founder of the Hippocratic Movement, an organization whose mission is to promote awareness that it is a fundamental requirement of health professionals to provide excellence in both: science and humanistic treatment.
Degree in Pharmacy (San Pablo-CEU University).
Expert in Orthopedics (University of Alcalá).
Master in Business Administration (Instituto de Empresa).
Associate professor of the subject Pharmacy and its partners (Francisco de Vitoria University).
Head of the Pharmacy Office in Las Rozas (Madrid).
PhD in medical humanities from the UCM.
Currently assistant manager of the Hospital Clínico San Carlos
For 5 years he was general director of patient care of the Madrid health service and Deputy Minister of Health of the Community of Madrid.
